history.content:
Are you interested in data science or research?

 

Then join The Data DeCal!

 

This 2 unit course will cover topics in research methods and applications to data science that can be used in research applications, industrial applications, and to solve open ended questions. The course will culminate in a final project of your own design that highlights knowledge that you've learned in the course and applying that to solve a research question or business problem that you are interested in.

 

If you are interested in joining this course as a student (or staff member!) please fill out the relevant interest form below or visit our course website!



Website: https://db.berkeley.edu/decal

Decal link: https://decal.berkeley.edu/courses/5007

Syllabus: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1DDdxbPQlEqbMdFBftRywDYJfq9ms06z2KLV0DANMXDE/edit?usp=sharing

Student Interest form: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScySsKtZrf7ERNoJwi_k4lDPy_SsyXNyKKMzyDYbHJ4Qx7lag/viewform (Data 100 or equivalent knowledge prerequisite)

Staff Interest form: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeIOF_JFDYzIcEVB34CuDnJf4K0N7YK0TSP-b8JFgWz6jb-TA/viewform (Curriculum Developer, TA, or Web Developer)



If you would like more information than we've provided here, or if you want to chat about any questions related to this course, please email decal@db.berkeley.edu and we'd be happy to talk!

 

Thanks,

Vinay Maruri, Madeleine Liu, Alan Pham
